QUESTION.QUESTION_INSTRUCTION: 1)Please write java code inside the method 'getIntersection(Set

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void getIntersectionTest1(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Ian Darwin"); temp_array2.add("Bill Dooley"); temp_array2.add("Doolin' Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet(); temp_answer.add("Ian Darwin");temp_answer.add("Bill Dooley");Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest2(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Bill Gats"); temp_array2.add("james Gosling"); temp_array2.add("Doolin Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest3(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Ian Darwin");temp_array1.add("Bill Dooley");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("iAN dARWIN"); temp_array2.add("bILL dOOLEY"); temp_array2.add("Doolin' Dalton");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet(); Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest4(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("Bill Gats"); temp_array1.add("Abrahim Linken");temp_array1.add("Jesse James");Set<Object> temp_array2 = new HashSet(); temp_array2.add("Abrahim Linken"); temp_array2.add("Jesse James"); temp_array2.add("Bill Gats");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();temp_answer.add("Bill Gats"); temp_answer.add("Abrahim Linken");temp_answer.add("Jesse James");Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

@Test public void getIntersectionTest5(){Set<Object> temp_array1 = new HashSet();temp_array1.add("a"); temp_array1.add("b");temp_array1.add("c");Set temp_array2 = new HashSet();temp_array2.add("a"); temp_array2.add("d"); temp_array2.add("e");Set<Object> temp_answer = new HashSet();Assert.assertEquals(temp_answer, getIntersection(temp_array1, temp_array2));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_INSTRUCTION:
1)Please write java code inside the method 'tringMergeToIntergerArray (String a, String b)'.
2)Please implement this method to return the sorted array of integer.You are given 2 separate pipe separated strings (let’s call them A & B) and each one contains numeric values separated by pipe ‘|’ character.Write a method to read all the values in A & B and merge them and then finally present the sorted integer array as output
3)The method is expected to following input may be provided and desired output corresponding to respective input is shown below
Input Output
"8|18|15|3","4|9|12|19|20|16"{3,4,8,9,12,15,16,18,19,20}
"4|10|2|9|6","8|18|15|3"{{2,3,4,6,8,9,10,15,18}}
"4|9|12|19|20|16","8|18|23|12|19|15|3"{3,4,8,9,12,12,15,16,18,19,19,20,23}
"4|9|12|19|20|16","8|18|23|12|19|15|3"{"Abrahim Linken","Jesse James","Bill Gats"}
{"a","b","c"},{"a","d","e"}

Please do not change class name and method name

TEST_CASE.TEST_SCRIPT: @Test public void stringMergeToIntergerArray1(){ String firstinput="8|18|15|3"; String secondinput="4|9|12|19|20|16";int[] output={3,4,8,9,12,15,16,18,19,20}; Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(output,stringMergeToIntergerArray(firstinput,secondinput)));}

@Test public void stringMergeToIntergerArray2(){ String firstinput="4|10|2|9|6"; String secondinput="8|18|15|3";int []output={2,3,4,6,8,9,10,15,18}; Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(output,stringMergeToIntergerArray(firstinput,secondinput)));}

@Test public void stringMergeToIntergerArray3(){ String firstinput="4|9|12|19|20|16"; String secondinput="8|18|23|12|19|15|3";int []output={3,4,8,9,12,12,15,16,18,19,19,20,23}; Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(output,stringMergeToIntergerArray(firstinput,secondinput)));}
@Test public void stringMergeToIntergerArray4(){ try{String firstinput="4|9|12|19|20|16"; String secondinput="8|18|23|12|19|15|3";} catch(NullPointerException e){assertTrue(false);}}

@Test public void stringMergeToIntergerArray5(){ String firstinput="11|4|6"; String secondinput="8|18|23";int []output={4,6,8,11,18,23}; Assert.assertTrue(Arrays.equals(output,stringMergeToIntergerArray(firstinput,secondinput)));}

QUESTION.QUESTION_INSTRUCTION:
Please write java code inside the method 'generateRandomNumber'.

The method is expected to following input may be provided and desired output corresponding to respective input is shown below
Input Output
2,202<=number<=20
0,20<=number<=2
20,3020<=number<=30
1,11<=number<=1
100,120100<=number<=120

Please do not change class name and method name
QUESTION.ANSWER:
import java.util.*;
public class MyClassThree
{

public static int generateRandomNumber(int min, int max)
{

/*
Please implement this method to return a random number in between min number and max number. You need to use random() method available in java.lang.Math class. This method returns a double value between 0.0 to 1.0.
*/
double minD=(double)min;
double maxD=(double)max;
while(true)
{
double random=(Math.random())*maxD;
if(random>=minD&&random<=maxD)
{
int r=(int)random;
System.out.print(r);
break;
}
}
return 0;
}

public static void main(String arr[])
{

/* Main Method*/
MyClassThree.generateRandomNumber(1,10);

}

}

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: What will happen if you change a class while your Java application is running. Assume that the instance of this class has been already created by the application when change was made.

OPTIONS.OPTION: The changes made to the class would be reflected in the application since the byte code has changed
The changes made to the class would not be reflected in the class as the class is loaded in the memory
When the class change is detected, JVM reloads the class
When class change is detected, your application would crash
JVM loads the class only once, so the change would not be detected

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: When is static block of a class called

OPTIONS.OPTION: Static block of a class is called when the class is loaded
Static block gets called as soon as application containing that class is started, irrespective of whether that class is referred or not
Static block gets called, when you refer to the class first time in the application lifecycle
Static block gets called every time when you create instance of the class
Static block gets called only once during execution of JVM

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: How is ARP (Address resolution protocol) used in network communication.

OPTIONS.OPTION: When you browse a website (google.com), your computer uses ARP to get MAC address (physical address) of that website

ARP is only used only within a physical network where computers are directly connected to each other using a switch or hub. So for getting Mac address(physical address) of external website (Google.com), ARP is not used by your computer
ARP is used to get MAC address (physical address) of a computer using its IP address
ARP is used to get IP address of a computer using its MAC address (physical address)
When computer wants to directly/physically communicate with another computer it requires its physical address which is retrieved using ARP

QUESTION.QUESTION_DESCRIPTION: Preemption is the act of temporarily interrupting a task being carried out by a computer system, without requiring its cooperation, and with the intention of resuming the task at a later time. Please mark statements as correct or incorrect in context of Preemption concept used in Operating System

OPTIONS.OPTION: This is also known generally as Context Switching
It is normally carried out by a privileged task or part of the system known as a preemptive scheduler, which has the power to preempt, or interrupt, and later resume, other tasks in the system

The period of time for which a process is allowed to run in a preemptive multitasking system is generally called the time slice, or quantum. The scheduler is run once every time slice to choose the next process to run

Multitasking operating system do not permit preemption of tasks whereas Cooperative operating system does allow preemption. Therefore in Multitasking operating system, processes/tasks must be explicitly programmed to yield when they do not require system resources

Preemptive multitasking do not interrupt the current running processes; but rather allow them to complete and then find the next process to execute. This basically saves operating system from switching context again and again and thereby save its resources
